Here's the same thing but limited to Naxos.  The average distance from closest shore is nearly 2 km and half the sites are within 1423 m to the shore.   These values are larger than for Grotta-Pelos as a whole.  Why is this?  Naxos is a bigger island.

Sites in the Grotta-Pelos culture are an average of 1100 m from the closest shore. But more than half are closer than 261 m.  These Cycladic sites are heavily positioned/skewed towards the coast - being on islands.

#Digitalhumanities #exeter #TheatreRoyal #SpecialCollections #Digitalisation

The fire was also referenced in later regulations like the 1934 'Manual of Safety Requirements in Theatres and other Places of Public Entertainment'. This required safety curtains meant to resist and delay fires.

#Digitalhumanities #exeter #TheatreRoyal #SpecialCollections #Digitalisation

The incident led to greater safety precautions. Fire insurance companies imposed lengthy inspections and heavy non-compliance premiums on their theatre clients. The financial impact forced quick change

#Digitalhumanities #exeter #TheatreRoyal #SpecialCollections #Digitalisation

The Theatre Royal's history is woven from a rich theatrical and deeply musical fabric that was sewn together by countless talents. For example, the great comic actor Sir Henry Lytton, the D'Oyly Carte opera Company, Mrs Patrick Campbell, and Morecambe and Wise

Unpacking the role of media in shaping public opinion during historical events: Our study on the USS Maine explosion uses digital archives to analyze coverage in seven countries. Insights into media influence and bias #DigitalHumanities #MediaHistory

Our digital humanities research provides a new perspective on the USS Maine explosion through a data-assisted analysis of international newspaper coverage. See how different narratives influenced the lead-up to the Spanish-American War #DigitalHumanities #History

How did newspapers from seven different countries report the USS Maine explosion in 1898? Our digital humanities research employs statistical and close reading methods to uncover biases in historical journalism #DigitalHumanities #TransnationalJournalism

Join us in exploring how digital tools enhance our understanding of historical media biases. Our latest study on the USS Maine explosion uses quantitative analysis to trace certain discursive constructions of the event across countries #DigitalHumanities #MediaStudies

Delving into the archives: Our digital humanities project analyzes the initial global newspaper reactions to the USS Maine explosion in 1898. Discover how media shaped the prelude to the Spanish-American War #DigitalHumanities #HistoricalMedia https://bit.ly/3BPMuKS

Join us in exploring how digital tools enhance our understanding of historical media biases. Our latest study on the USS Maine explosion uses quantitative analysis to trace certain discursive constructions of the event across countries #DigitalHumanities #MediaStudies
